pull.title: guix: use libtool 2.4.7
pull.body:
As of version 2.4.7, libtool now respects ARFLAGS, and has changed the default `ARFLAGS` from `cru` to `cr` (which, historically, we have also done, [see configure](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/d6832217ef45ea0c858e3fcdec5d4fe87097c839/configure.ac#L33)).

This eliminates spammy `ar` output such as:
```bash
  CXXLD    libunivalue.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  AR       libbitcoin_zmq.a
  AR       libbitcoin_consensus.a
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_base.la
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_sse41.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_avx2.la
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_x86_shani.la
  CXXLD    leveldb/libleveldb.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  CXXLD    crc32c/libcrc32c.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  CXXLD    leveldb/libmemenv.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  AR       libbitcoin_cli.a
```

[Libtool 2.4.7 release notes](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/autotools-announce/2022-03/msg00000.html):
** New features:

  - Libtool script now supports (configure-time and runtime) ARFLAGS
    variable, which obsoletes AR_FLAGS.  This is due to naming conventions
    among other *FLAGS and to be consistent with Automake's ARFLAGS.

** Important incompatible changes:

  - Libtool changed ARFLAGS/AR_FLAGS default from 'cru' to 'cr'.

verification.payload:
tree 2e6686b28d08fc94c09075884e4e84532076b683
parent d6832217ef45ea0c858e3fcdec5d4fe87097c839
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1655374444 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1655374662 +0100

guix: use libtool 2.4.7

As of version 2.4.7, libtool now respects ARFLAGS, which we use, and has
changed the default ARFLAGS from cru to cr (which we also do, see
configure).

This eliminates spammy `ar` output such as:
```bash
  CXXLD    libunivalue.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  AR       libbitcoin_zmq.a
  AR       libbitcoin_consensus.a
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_base.la
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_sse41.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_avx2.la
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_x86_shani.la
  CXXLD    leveldb/libleveldb.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  CXXLD    crc32c/libcrc32c.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  CXXLD    leveldb/libmemenv.la
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
/root/.guix-profile/bin/x86_64-linux-gnu-ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')
  AR       libbitcoin_cli.a
```

Libtool 2.4.7 release notes:
https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/autotools-announce/2022-03/msg00000.html

As of version 2.4.7, libtool now respects ARFLAGS, which we use, and has
changed the default ARFLAGS from cru to cr (which we also do, see

```bash

  AR       libbitcoin_consensus.a
  CXXLD    crypto/libbitcoin_crypto_base.la

  CXXLD    leveldb/libleveldb.la

tree bc818fd7fe41dceb8d05940621c3f6f11b6ec3fa
parent 679ecdd14bf26b4fc3bdb73b6200f5e59d15e9a6
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1655374786 +0100

doc: update configure ar doc to mention libtool 2.4.7

events.message: doc: update configure ar doc to mention libtool 2.4.7

events.body:
> use libtool 2.4.7

What is the current libtool version been used in guix?

> What is the current libtool version been used in guix?

2.4.6

GUIX hashes on arm64, mine match @fanquake:

```
$ env HOSTS='arm-linux-gnueabihf arm64-apple-darwin powerpc64-linux-gnu powerpc64le-linux-gnu riscv64-linux-gnu x86_64-apple-darwin x86_64-linux-gnu x86_64-w64-mingw32' ./contrib/guix/guix-build 
$ find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum

b70e6fc1be044e347800d7de78a1c950961f5c52abc724fa8c6fe8556b3ef3ca  guix-build-4a81ef451094/output/arm-linux-gnueabihf/SHA256SUMS.part

> > What is the current libtool version been used in guix?
> 
> 2.4.6

Is it worth to diverge Guix environment libtool from one which is available on most developer systems (Ubuntu Jammy has libtool 2.4.6)?

> Is it worth to diverge Guix environment libtool 

Yes. I don't see what issues this could cause, and is an improvement to the build environment. The point of Guix is not to replicate the "average" developer environment. When we decide what tooling (i.e compilers) to use to produce releases, we will take into account their availability on systems that developers are using, but for libtool, I don't think this is anywhere near as important.

> for libtool, I don't think this is anywhere near as important.

I was going to say that since we no longer distribute bootstrapped tarballs this is less true. But if there were an actual divergence between our Guix-specified autotools and autotools on the average developer setup that leads to bootstrapping/build failures, the CI's would catch that, so I think it's fine.
